info.title: Contentstack Content Management API OpenAPI Specification
info.description:
Contentstack provides a set of read-write APIs that enables you to interact with the information and perform any tasks within your Contentstack account. You can create\/edit\/delete entries and assets, manage Content Types, etc., using these APIs. Contentstack provides an OpenAPI JSON file that consists of a set of preconfigured REST API requests that will make it easy for you to get started with the Contentstack Management APIs and try out our API requests through the Swagger Editor.

CMA OpenAPI Details:

  • Version: 1.0.0
  • Last Updated: March 21, 2022

get.description:
The Get user call returns comprehensive information of an existing user account. The information returned includes details of the stacks owned by and shared with the specified user account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get user API Reference document

put.description:
The Update User API Request updates the details of an existing user account. Only the information entered here will be updated, the existing data will remain unaffected.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update user API Reference document

post.description:
The Activate a user account call activates the account of a user after signing up. For account activation, you will require the token received in the activation email.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Activate a user account API Reference document

The Request for a password API helps to get a temporary password to log into an account in case a user has forgotten the login password.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Request for a password API Reference document

The Reset password API request allows you to reset your Contentstack account password.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Reset password API Reference document

The Log in to your account request is used to sign in to your Contentstack account and obtain the authtoken.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Log in to your account API Reference document

delete.description:
The Log out of your account call is used to sign out the user of Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Log out of your account API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all organizations call lists all organizations related to the system user in the order that they were created.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all Organizations API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of entries in the output. Example, if there are 10 organizations and you wish to fetch only the first 2, you need to specify '2' as the value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of organizations in the output. Example, if there are 12 organizations and you want to skip the first 2 to get only the last 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organizations in the ascending order with respect to the value of a specific field.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of Organizations in the descending order with respect to the value of a specific field.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of organizations related to the user. Example: If you wish to know the total number of organizations, you need to mention ‘true’.

parameters.name: typeahead
parameters.description: The typeahead parameter is a type of filter that allows you to perform a name-based search on all organizations based on the value provided. Example, if we have four organizations named ‘ABC’, ‘ABC1’, ‘XYZ’, and ‘ACC’, and we provide ‘ABC’ as the value to this parameter, the search result will return the organizations ‘ABC’ and ‘ABC1’ as the output.

get.description:
The Get a single organization call gets the comprehensive details of a specific organization related to the system user.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get a single Organization API Reference document

parameters.name: include_plan
parameters.description: The include_plan parameter includes the details of the plan that the organization has subscribed to. To include the details of the subscribed plan in the Response body, enter ‘true’.

get.summary: Get all roles in an Organization
get.description:
The Get all roles in an organization call gives the details of all the roles that are set to users in an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all roles in an Organization API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of Organization roles in the output. Example, if there are 10 organization roles and you wish to fetch only the first 2, you need to specify '2' as the value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of Organization roles in the output. For example, if there are 12 organization roles and you want to skip the first 2 to get only the last 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization roles in an ascending order on the basis of a parameter.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization roles in a descending order on the basis of a parameter.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of roles in an organization. For example: If you want to know the total number of roles in an organization, you need to mention ‘true’.

parameters.name: include_stack_roles
parameters.description: The ‘include_stack_roles’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, includes the details of stack-level roles in the Response body.

post.description:
The Add users to organization call allows you to send invitations to add users to your organization. Only the owner or the admin of the organization can add users.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Add users to Organization API Reference document

delete.description:
The Remove users from organization request allows you to remove existing users from your organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Remove users from organization API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all organization invitations call gives you a list of all the Organization invitations. Only the owner or the admin of the Organization can resend the invitation to add users to an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all Organization invitations API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of sent organization invitations in the output. Example, if 10 invitations were sent out and you wish to fetch only the first 8, you need to specify '2' as the value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of organization roles in the output. Example, if there are 12 organization roles and you want to skip the last 2 to get only the first 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization invitations in ascending order on the basis of a specific parameter.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of organization invitations in descending order on the basis of a specific parameter.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of organization invitations sent out. Example: If you wish to know the total number of organization invitations, you need to mention ‘true’.

parameters.name: include_roles
parameters.description: The ‘include_roles’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, will display the details of the roles that are assigned to the user in an organization.

parameters.name: include_invited_by
parameters.description: The ‘include_invited_by’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, includes the details of the user who sent out the organization invitation.

parameters.name: include_user_details
parameters.description: The ‘include_user_details’ parameter, when set to ‘true’, lets you know whether the user who has been sent the organization invitation has enabled Two-factor Authentication or not.

parameters.name: typeahead
parameters.description: The ‘typeahead’ parameter allows you to perform a name-based search on all the stacks on an organization based on the value provided. For example, it allows you to perform an email-ID-based search on all users based on the email ID provided.

get.description:
The Resend pending organization invitation call allows you to resend Organization invitations to users who have not yet accepted the earlier invitation. Only the owner or the admin of the Organization can resend the invitation to add users to an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Resend pending Organization invitation API Reference document

post.description:
The Transfer organization ownership call transfers the ownership of an Organization to another user. When the call is executed, an email invitation for accepting the ownership of a particular Organization is sent to the specified user.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Transfer Organization ownership API Reference document

get.summary: Get all stacks in an Organization
get.description:
The Get all stacks in an organization call fetches the list of all stacks in an Organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all stacks in an Organization API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of stacks in the output. Example, if there are 10 organization stacks and you wish to fetch only the first 2, you need to specify '2' as value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of organization stacks in the output. Example, if there are 12 stacks and you want to skip the last 2 to get only the first 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: asc
parameters.description: The ‘asc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of stacks in an organization in the ascending order.

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The ‘desc’ parameter allows you to sort the list of stacks in an organization in the descending order.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter returns the total number of stacks in an organization. Example: If you wish to know the total number of stacks in your organization, you need to mention ‘true’.

parameters.name: typeahead
parameters.description: The ‘typeahead’ parameter allows you to perform a name-based search on all the stacks on an organization based on the value provided.

get.description:
The Get organization log details request is used to retrieve the audit log details of an organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get organization log details API Reference document

The Get organization log item request is used to retrieve a specific item from the audit log of an organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get organization log item API Reference document

get.summary: Get a single stack | Get all users of a stack
get.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below: And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Get a single stack
  • Get all users of a stack

parameters.name: include_collaborators
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include the details of the stack collaborators.

parameters.name: include_stack_variables
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the stack variables. Stack variables are extra information about the stack, such as the description, format of date, format of time, and so on. Users can include or exclude stack variables in the response.

parameters.name: include_discrete_variables
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to view the access token of your stack.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in the response the total count of the stacks owned by or shared with a user account.

post.description:
The Create stack call creates a new stack in your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create stack API Reference document

put.description:
The Update stack call lets you update the name and description of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update stack API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete stack call is used to delete an existing stack permanently from your Contentstack account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete stack API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all stacks call fetches the list of all stacks owned by and shared with a particular user account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all stacks API Reference document

parameters.name: include_collaborators
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include the details of the stack collaborators.

parameters.name: include_stack_variables
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the stack variables. Stack variables are extra information about the stack, such as the description, format of date, format of time, and so on. Users can include or exclude stack variables in the response.

parameters.name: include_discrete_variables
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to view the access token of your stack.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in the response the total count of the stacks owned by or shared with a user account.

post.description:
The Update User Role API Request updates the roles of an existing user account. This API Request will override the existing roles assigned to a user. For example, we have an existing user with the "Developer" role, and if you execute this API request with "Content Manager" role, the user role will lose "Developer" rights and the user role be updated to just "Content Manager".

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Update User Role API Reference document

post.summary: Transfer stack ownership to other users
post.description:
The Transfer stack ownership to other users call sends the specified user an email invitation for accepting the ownership of a particular stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Transfer stack ownership to other users API Reference document

get.summary: Accept stack owned by other user
get.description:
The Accept stack owned by other user call allows a user to accept the ownership of a particular stack via an email invitation.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Accept stack owned by other user API Reference document

parameters.name: uid
parameters.description: Enter the user uid.

get.description:
The Get stack settings call retrieves the configuration settings of an existing stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get stack settings API Reference document

post.summary: Add stack settings | Reset stack settings
post.description:
For more information on the individual requests, click on their respective documentation links below: And below this line, we'll be providing the documentation links in bulleted list form.

  • Add stack settings
  • Reset stack settings

The Share a stack call shares a stack with the specified user to collaborate on the stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Share a stack API Reference document

The Unshare a stack call unshares a stack with a user and removes the user account from the list of collaborators. Once this call is executed, the user will not be able to view the stack in their account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Unshare a stack API Reference document

get.description:
The Get all branches request returns comprehensive information of all the branches available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all branches API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of branches to be returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of branches to be skipped from the response body.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include in response the total count of branches available in a stack.

post.description:
The Create a branch request creates a new branch in a particular stack of your organization.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create a branch API Reference document

get.description:
The Get a single branch request returns information of a specific branch.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get a single branch API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete a branch request deletes an existing branch and all the content within it.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete a branch API Reference document

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to force delete a branch.

get.description:
The Get all aliases request returns comprehensive information of all the aliases available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all aliases API Reference document

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of branches to be returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of branches to be skipped from the response body.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include in response the total count of branches available in a stack.

get.description:
The Get a single alias request returns information of a specific alias.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get a single alias API Reference document

put.description:
The Assign an alias request creates a new alias in a particular stack of your organization. This alias can point to any existing branch (target branch) of your stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Assign or Update an alias API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete an alias request deletes an existing alias.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete an alias API Reference document

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to force delete an alias.

get.description:
The Get all content types call returns comprehensive information of all the content types available in a particular stack in your account.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all content types API Reference document

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the total count of content types available in your stack.

parameters.name: include_global_field_schema
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include in response the details of all the fields within the Global field's schema.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get a single content type API Reference document

parameters.name: version

delete.description:
The Delete Content Type call deletes an existing content type and all the entries within it.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete Content Type API Reference document

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to force delete a content type.

get.summary: Get all references of content type
get.description:
The Get all references of content type call will fetch all the content types in which a specified content type is referenced.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all references of content type API Reference document

parameters.name: include_global_fields
parameters.description: Set the include_global_fields parameter to “true” to retrieve all the Global fields in which the specified content type is referenced.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
This call is used to export a specific content type and its schema. The data is exported in JSON format.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Export a content type API Reference document

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Enter the version of content type you want to retrieve. If no version is specified, you will get the latest version of the content type.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

post.description:
The Import a content type call imports a content type into a stack by uploading JSON file.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import a content type API Reference document

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Select 'true' to replace the existing content type with the imported content type file.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

content_type.description: Upload the JSON file of the content type that you want to import.

get.description:

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Create a global field API Reference document

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

parameters.name: include_branch

The Import a global field call imports a global field into a stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken.

get.description:
This request is used to export a specific global field and its schema. The data is exported in JSON format.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Export a global field API Reference document

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
The Get all entries call fetches the list of all the entries of a particular content type. It also returns the content of each entry in JSON format. You can also specify the environment and locale of which you wish to get the entries.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all entries API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries needs to be included. Only the entries published in this locale will be displayed.

parameters.name: include_workflow
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the workflow details of the entry.

parameters.name: include_publish_details
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the publish details of the entry.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

delete.description:
The Delete an entry request allows you to delete a specific entry from a content type. This API request also allows you to delete single and/or multiple localized entries.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete an entry API Reference document

parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entry needs to be deleted.

parameters.description: Set the "delete_all_localized" parameter to "true" to delete all the localized versions of the entry.

post.description:
The Set Version Name for Entry request allows you to assign a name to a specific version of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Set Version Name for Entry API Reference document

delete.description:
The Delete Version Name of Entry request allows you to delete the name assigned to a specific version of an entry. This request resets the name of the entry version to the version number.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Delete Version Name of Entry API Reference document

get.summary: Get Details of All Versions of an Entry

The Get Details of All Versions of an Entry request allows you to retrieve the details of all the versions of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get Details of All Versions of an Entry API Reference document

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of version details to be skipped.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of version details to be returned.

parameters.name: named
parameters.description: Set to ‘true’ if you want to retrieve only the named versions of your entry.

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to get the total count of the entry version details.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language of which the entries need to be included. Only the version details of entries published in this locale will be displayed.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

post.description:
The Import an entry call is used to import an entry. To import an entry, you need to upload a JSON file that has entry data in the format that fits the schema of the content type it is being imported to.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import an entry API Reference document

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Enter the code of the language to import the entry of that particular language.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Select 'true' to replace an existing entry with the imported entry file.

parameters.name: inclue_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

entry.description: Upload the JSON file of the entry that you want to import.

post.description:
The Import an existing entry call will import a new version of an existing entry. You can create multiple versions of an entry.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Import an existing entry API Reference document

post.description:
The Publish an entry request lets you publish an entry either immediately or schedule it for a later date/time.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Publish an entry API Reference document

parameters.description: Set this parameter to 'true' to include the total number of assets available in your stack in the response body.

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the relative URL of the asset.

post.description:
The Upload asset request uploads an asset file to your stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Upload asset API Reference document

parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

asset[upload].description: Select the input type as 'File'. Then, browse and select the asset file that you want to import. Supported file types include JPG, GIF, PNG, XML, WebP, BMP, TIFF, SVG, and PSD.

asset[parent_uid].description: If needed, assign a parent folder to your asset by passing the UID of the parent folder in this parameter.

asset[title].description: Enter a title for your uploaded asset.

asset[description].description: Enter a description for your uploaded asset.

asset[tags].description: Assign a specific tag(s) to your uploaded asset.

get.description:
The Get an asset call returns comprehensive information about a specific version of an asset of a stack.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get an asset API Reference document

parameters.name: include_path
parameters.description: Set this parameter to ‘true’ to retrieve the complete path of the folder. The path will be displayed as an array of objects which includes the names and UIDs of each parent folder.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description:
Specify the version number of the asset that you want to retrieve. If the version is not specified, the details of the latest version will be retrieved.
Note: If no version is mentioned, this request will retrieve the latest published version of the asset. To retrieve a specific version, make use of the version parameter and keep the environment parameter blank.

parameters.name: environment_name
parameters.description: Enter the name of the environment to retrieve assets published on them. You can enter multiple environments.

parameters.name: environment
parameters.description: Enter the name of the environment to retrieve assets published on them. You can enter multiple environments.

parameters.name: include_publish_details
parameters.description: Enter 'true' to include the publish details of the asset.

parameters.name: relative_urls
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to display the relative URL of the asset. This parameter is not applicable when you delete an asset.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
The Get all Releases request retrieves a list of all Releases of a stack along with details of each Release.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all Releases API Reference document

parameters.name: include_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_count’ parameter includes the count of total number of releases in your stack, along with the details of each release. Example: If you want to know the total number of releases, you need to mention ‘true’ as the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The ‘count’ parameter works similar to the ‘include_count’ parameter but returns ONLY the total count of releases in your stack and not the details of the releases in the response. Example: If you want to know the total number of releases in your stack, you need to mention ‘true’ as value for this parameter.

parameters.name: include_items_count
parameters.description: The ‘include_items_count’ parameter returns the total number of items in a specific release. Example: If you want to know the total number of items in a release, you need to mention ‘true’ as the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The ‘limit’ parameter will return a specific number of releases in the output. Example, if there are 10 releases and you want to fetch the  five latest updated releases, you need to specify '5' as value in this parameter.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The ‘skip’ parameter will skip a specific number of releases in the response. Example: If there are 12 releases and you want to skip the first two updated releases to get only the next 10 in the response body, you need to specify ‘2’ here.

parameters.name: include_branch
parameters.description: Set this to 'true' to include the '_branch' top-level key in the response. This key states the unique ID of the branch where the concerned Contentstack module resides.

get.description:
The Get all Tasks request retrieves a list of all tasks assigned to you.

To use the API Request, you will need to authenticate yourself either with a Management Token (highly recommended) or an Authtoken. 
Read more about it in Authentication.


For more information, refer to the Get all Tasks API Reference document

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Enter the actual query that will be executed to retrieve the tasks. This query should be in JSON format. Example:


	{"job.publishing_rule.status":0}: retrieves pending approval requests
	{"type":"workflow_stage"}: retrieve tasks based on Workflow Stages
	{"job.workflow_stage.uid": "workflow_stage_uid"}: retrieve tasks based on a specific Workflow Stage 
	{"content_type":"content_type_uid", "type": "publishing_rule"}: retrieve tasks based on multiple conditions

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Enter the field UID on the basis of which you want to sort your tasks. Example: {"assigned_at": "desc"}, {"content_type": "asc"}, or {"assigned_date": "desc", "locale":"asc"}

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Enter the maximum number of tasks that you want to retrieve in the response.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enter the number of tasks to be skipped.
